Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Pearl-Fog’ offers the classic, versatile oyster mushroom profile: a mild, sweet, and nutty flavour with a hint of licorice or anise on the nose. The caps are smooth, tongue-shaped, and range from pale dove-gray to soft slate, growing in dense, overlapping clusters. The flesh is tender yet resilient, with a velvety texture that holds up well to cooking without becoming slimy.

2. The Ultimate Culinary Workhorse This mushroom’s mild but distinctive flavour and excellent texture make it incredibly adaptable in the kitchen.

  • Sautéed or Stir-fried: The premier method - quickly cooked over high heat with garlic and butter or oil, where it develops a beautiful sear and its sweet, nutty notes are enhanced.
  • Soups and Stews: Adds a rich, savory depth to broths and creamy soups, contributing umami without overpowering other ingredients.
  • “Pulled” Meat Substitute: The fibrous texture of the larger caps makes them ideal for shredding and braising, creating a satisfying plant-based alternative for sandwiches and tacos.
  • Tempura and Frying: Its delicate flesh and ability to hold a light batter make it excellent for frying, resulting in a crisp exterior and tender interior.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Pearl-Fog’ is a rapid and prolific fruiter. Harvest entire clusters by twisting gently at the base when the caps are still slightly curled under but have fully expanded; avoid waiting until the edges flatten completely. Supplied as a pre-colonized MycoBlock™, it provides a substantial and reliable yield of 600–900g of fresh mushrooms over 2-3 heavy flushes, with the first harvest ready for picking just 10-14 days after initiating fruiting conditions.
